title.rendered: Babar Azam chooses BBL over IPL

content.rendered:
Babar Azam, the captain of the Pakistan squad, prefers the Big Bash League (BBL) to the cash-rich Indian Premier League (IPL).(IPL). Babar, who is currently playing for Peshawar Zalmi in the Pakistan Super League (PSL) 2023, announced his decision on Zalmi TV. According to the Zalmi captain, playing on fast and bouncy pitches on Australian territory teaches batsmen a lot. According to Babar, the circumstances in the IPL will be similar to those in Pakistan. “Over there in Australia, the circumstances are different. The fields in Australia are quick, and you learn a lot there. “You catch similar Asian conditions in IPL,” Babar said.

Former Indian player Harbhajan Singh, in the meantime, has responded to Babar’s comment. The performer, who’s presently taking part in the Legends League Cricket(LLC) 2023, just put an emoticon to express his views.


Babar has been in miraculous form of late after he chased his lovable T20 hundred in the league match against Sarfaraz Ahmed’s Quetta pugilists. He missed out on Zalmi’s league fixture against Islamabad United but turned back for Eliminator 1 against the same challenger.
Babar Azam also became the fastest batter to score 9000 runs in T20s in the match on Thursday, March 16 at the Gaddafi Stadium, Lahore. He got to the corner in 245 innings, breaking Chris Gayle’s record of 249 innings.
As far as Harbhajan is concerned, he’s the common-loftiest gate-taker in the LLC and is playing for the India Maharajas, who’ll play the LLC Eliminator 2 against Shahid Afridi’s Asia Lions on March 18.
